alert.note: Alert for Clark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 4:54PM EST until March 08 at 3:12PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers... Mad River at Springfield. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River at Springfield. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, West 1st Street in Springfield Township floods, including the Forest Lake Fishing and Campround area, with water approaching some businesses along West 1st Street. Spangler Road downstream of Springfield also floods. Flood waters approach several homes to the southwest of Springfield. In addition, the Mad River experiences widespread flooding in Champaign County near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 PM EST Monday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested. The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
